page.title: 11Bardon Hill Village
page.content: {Bardon Hill village}grew up because of the need to house the quarry workers{.The Old Row},a row of 40 terraced houses,was built first,then a similar row called{The Crescent}was built several years later.The first {school}was built in the Old Row in 1877 and our present school was built in 1895.We have 68 children on roll. There is no real centre to Bardon village and the only{amenities}are a Post Office,a pub,church and a sports field.As well as The Old Row and The Crescent there are other cottages, houses and farms scattered around the area and some industry down Grange Road{.Bardon Hall},which stands in a fine position in woodland on Bardon Hill,once stood further down the hill but the owners moved it to get a better view.The{moat}which surrounded it still remains on the original site.
